intro: Missiessya corymbulosa, commonly known as the Mississippian corymbulosa, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are ovate with a smooth texture and a slightly waxy surface. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland areas.
